qas.question: How many seats did the proposal for the new Everton stadium feature in 2000?
How much money did Everton FC need to generate for a half-stake in the new stadium project in 2000?
In what year did the Liverpool city council reject Everton FC's new stadium proposal?
In what year did Liverpool announce that they would build their own Stanley Park Stadium?
What team did Everton FC consider sharing grounds with around the year 2000?
How many people could Everton's stadium seat in 1996?
How many could have sat at the proposed stadium on Stanley Park?
What percentage of the costs for the proposed stadium was Liverpool F.C. able to raise?
How much money did Everton need to raise for the proposed stadium deal with Liverpool F.C.?
In what month in 2000 was the proposal submitted for the new stadium?

context: There have been indications since 1996 that Everton will move to a new stadium. The original plan was for a new <b5_0>60,000<b5_0/>-seat stadium to be built, but in 2000 a proposal was submitted to build a <a0_0><b6_0>55,000<b6_0/><a0_0/> seat stadium as part of the King's Dock regeneration. This was unsuccessful as Everton failed to generate the <a1_0><b8_0>£30 million<b8_0/><a1_0/> needed for a half stake in the stadium project, with the city council rejecting the proposal in <a2_0>2003<a2_0/>. Late in 2004, driven by Liverpool Council and the Northwest Development Corporation, the club entered talks with Liverpool F.C. about sharing a proposed stadium on Stanley Park. Negotiations broke down as Everton failed to raise <b7_0>50%<b7_0/> of the costs. On 11 <b9_0>January<b9_0/> <a3_0>2005<a3_0/>, <a4_0>Liverpool<a4_0/> announced that ground-sharing was not a possibility, proceeding to plan their own Stanley Park Stadium.
